content.name: Body
content.description: Physical strength and endurance. Use Body for actions like lifting, pushing, climbing, dragging, grappling, jumping, and swimming.

content.name: Agility
content.description: Speed and dexterity. Use Agility for actions like catching, squeezing through spaces, picking locks, escaping manacles, and @Dodge actions in combat.

content.name: Focus
content.description: Mental concentration and magical ability. Use Focus for perceiving, listening, conjuring magic with @GatherSpells, tracking prey, controlling will, and resisting enchantment.

content.name: Fate
content.description: Luck, life force, and destiny. Fate determines your @HitPoints and influences survival during @Death situations.

subsections.title: Rolling Stats
subsections.description: Roll 4d10s for character creation and assign values to @Body, @Agility, @Focus, @Fate. Maximum stat value is 9, minimum is 2.

sections.title: Basic Dice Mechanics
sections.description: Understanding how dice rolls work in I Must Kill

subsections.title: Standard Rolls
subsections.description: Roll 1d10. If the result is equal to or less than your relevant stat, you succeed.

subsections.title: Advantage
subsections.description: When you have @Advantage, roll 2d10 and choose the lower result. This represents favorable circumstances, specialized equipment, or tactical superiority.

subsections.title: Disadvantage
subsections.description: When you have @Disadvantage, roll 2d10 and choose the higher result. This represents poor conditions, being hindered, or unfavorable circumstances.

sections.title: Attack Stat and Hit Points
sections.description: Choose @Body, @Agility, or @Focus as your @AttackStat for combat rolls. Your @HitPoints equal half of your @Fate score (rounded up).

subsections.title: Random Start
subsections.description: Draw 10 equipment cards from the Starter Deck per player at the table, and each player can choose up to 10 from the whole lot.

subsections.title: Fixed Start
subsections.description: Choose 10 cards from your character deck to outfit your hunter.

sections.title: Adventuring Assumptions
sections.description: Your character is competent, and capable of taking care of themselves under normal circumstances. Basic needs like bandages, water, and food are assumed to be met unless the GM specifies otherwise. Equipment from packs are key items, not exhaustive lists. Money is kept in general terms - you either have enough or you don't.
